alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 19 at 3:17PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW ACCUMULATION ACROSS THE PEAKS OF THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS TONIGHT AND THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS INCLUDING CLINES CORNERS AND VAUGHN MONDAY MORNING... Snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches are possible mainly above 8,500 feet through sunrise Monday in the northern mountains along with 1-3 inches of accumulation for the central highlands in and near Clines Corners, Vaughn and Encino. This may create slick roads, including Bobcat Pass on Highway 38, Highway 518 through Tres Ritos, Highway 64 east of Tierra Amarilla, I-40 in and near Clines Corners and U.S. Highway 285 from Clines Corners to Ramon and west to Corona. Motorists should exercise caution, be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities and slick spots on roadways. Allow for extra time to reach your destination today and tonight. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Estancia Valley; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood
